meanings.definition: The condition of being addicted to work.
meanings.sent1: Her workaholisms often kept her in the office late into the night.
meanings.sent2: His workaholisms were evident in the countless hours he spent at his desk.
meanings.sent3: Despite his workaholisms, he still found time to enjoy a good book now and then.
meanings.sent4: Her workaholisms were like a heavy chain, binding her to her desk day in and day out.
meanings.sent5: The workaholisms of the CEO were legendary, inspiring both awe and concern among the employees.

meanings.sent1: The workaholisms of the team led to impressive productivity but also burnout.
meanings.sent2: His workaholisms were praised by the boss but criticized by his family.
meanings.sent3: The workaholisms of the accountant were so extreme that even the coffee machine seemed concerned.
meanings.sent4: Her workaholisms were like a never-ending race, with no finish line in sight.
meanings.sent5: The workaholisms of the artist were reflected in the intricate details of every painting.
